author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Version number is not allowed to contain prerelease or build data

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock]

> Version number is not allowed to contain prerelease or build data

This is a mistake. We should not apply this check to JLL packages. @giordano want to look into why this check was applied?

I dug up a bit in the code of `RegistryCI.jl`, my understanding is that that check is triggered because only @jlbuild [is expected](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/d7a2ea5563429e1224a406898eac24444da656c9/.github/workflows/automerge.yml#L53) to open pull requests for JLL packages, so other users will go through the standard checks.  I hope you can confirm my understanding.  In the meantime I'm going to merge this pull request anyway.

I've created release `v0.0.1+0`, [here](https://github.com/JuliaBinaryWrappers/Enzyme_jll.jl/releases/tag/v0.0.1%2B0) it is.
<!-- c65b3300-fdf2-11ea-9df7-33964cef3f47 -->

> I dug up a bit in the code of `RegistryCI.jl`, my understanding is that that check is triggered because only @jlbuild [is expected](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/d7a2ea5563429e1224a406898eac24444da656c9/.github/workflows/automerge.yml#L53) to open pull requests for JLL packages, so other users will go through the standard checks. I hope you can confirm my understanding. In the meantime I'm going to merge this pull request anyway.

Yes that is correct- we only apply the special JLL exemptions for registrations made by @jlbuild.

Is there a reason why this PR was made by JuliaRegistrator instead of @jlbuild?
Valentin built this locally and triggered registration with JuliaRegistrator, but this isn't the norm
Cool. Yeah if this workflow is rare, it's easy enough to just manually merge.
